Canker sores are one of those things "no pain, no gain". I've used numbing stuff even a brand called canka specifically made for canker sores, but application was painful and the numbness went away quick, leaves a terrible taste and most importantly made the sore last longer than 2 weeks which is clearly worse. The best thing to do is lick the tip of your finger, dip it in salt, I mean really get a good layer of salt on your finger, and then press the salt into the sore, I literally let the sore do the work and let it scoop up the salt. EXTREMELY PAINFUL, but once the pain crests the sore goes numb from endorphins and adrenaline, yeah it hurts that bad, but I've had sores cover themselves up overnight from this method, never had to go longer than a week even for big ones, my mom says salt dries the wound out and let's it heal quickly. I think salt makes the wound hurt like hell, therefore the body focuses on healing that and in the meantime the endorphins help you live a normal life while Satan lives in your mouth

I had canker sores for years and years. Multiple in my mouth at a time. Hurt all the time. Found the solution. I started using a charcoal based toothpaste.. and I haven't gotten any canker sores in years. I wish somebody told me about this solution a long time ago. SLS is the same ingredient found in hand soaps and dish detergents. Keep it away from your mouth. Now, if I bite my mouth I have a small irritated spot that lasts for only a couple of days.. but never really turns into a canker sore. I used to get several canker sores a month for as long as I can remember, some were a centimeter wide and sometimes I'd have several at once, and all of them hurt like heck. About three years ago I started learning about 'good' (beneficial) and 'bad' bacteria in the gut microbiome, and I wondered if the same thing was happening in my mouth with its own microbiome. I used mouthwash every time I brushed my teeth, so I figured maybe something in my mouth was protecting me from canker sores, and maybe I was washing it out when I used the mouthwash?

To test that hypothesis, I quit using mouthwash for a year while continuing to brush my teeth twice a day. I was surprised that I didn't have a single canker sore for that entire year. To further test the idea, I then bought a relatively tame organic mouthwash and used it for a week, and I ended up getting a canker sore at the end of the week. After that week, I quit using mouthwash altogether and I still brush my teeth with Sensodyne twice a day, and I haven't had a canker sore for the past two years.

I can't guarantee that abstaining from using mouthwash will work for you, but it definitely works for me. If you try this, make sure you use a toothpaste that doesn't have any antibiotics in it, and make sure you Only brush your teeth (don't use any mouthwash or mouth rinse, only rinse with plain water if necessary).

Remember - canker sores are Not cold sores! Cold sores are caused by a variant of the herpes simplex family of viruses, and canker sores currently aren't fully understood what causes them and why some people get them and others don't. This mouth microbiome protection idea will Not get rid of cold sores.

Please let me know your results if you try this idea yourself, because I'm curious to know if there is a mouth microbiome that protects against canker sores. Thank you for reading my comment, and I hope you have a good day today!

HEAL YOURSELF COMPLETELY FROM THE HERPES SIMPLEX, ( COLD SORES, HPV & CERVICAL CANCER.   

   

  I was diagnosed with Stage 2 cervical cancer (adenocarcinoma) at age 36. A single mother with two children, ages 6 and 8.


I had abnormal Pap smears starting 8 years prior, when I was pregnant with my daughter. I was never told that I had HPV, even though I did. After each abnormal Pap test result, I would have a LEEP and colposcopy.


 During colposcopy, the doctor uses an instrument to magnify the cervix to see any abnormal cells. Often the doctor takes a small sample of tissue (biopsy) to be checked for cancer and other abnormalities. LEEP—short for loop electrosurgical excision procedure—uses electric current passed through a thin wire loop to remove abnormal tissue.]


And then, I had abnormal bleeding. I thought it was from a poorly placed IUD. I went to my gynecologist, who said, “You know, you have this history, and you have HPV, and so I’m going to do a Pap, but this time I’ll sample cells a little higher up in your cervix.”


I got abnormal results again and scheduled yet another colposcopy for the day before Thanksgiving. I still really wasn’t concerned. I got the results on December 15th, three days before my school’s winter break. My doctor called while I was teaching and said, “I have your results. You have cancer. I can’t treat you, and I have referred you to an oncologist. They will be calling today. You probably will have to have a hysterectomy.” I left work, and sat in my car, in shock. I sat there for maybe 45 minutes before the tears came. I had no idea what to expect. All I knew was I could not die, I had two babies who needed me.

I get alot over the years. My method is always the same.
First be sure to wait until night to dry your mouth, then put some salt on your finger and dab it let it sit for about 5 seconds and then lick it away (it stings I know but it works)
Then get good old Listerine, preferably with alcohol. Take a swig and swish it around. Let it sit and then spit, but don't rinse immediately, let it sit, it's going to sting.
Now get a a paper towel and take maybe a sticky note in size of it. Fold it into a small square or rectangle and wet it, now insert this square or rectangle of moist paper towel against your teeth and the canker, then sleep with it til the morning.
Do this process for a few days and it should be gone in 3 night if you do it immediately after getting a sore.

I tend to chew and eat quickly, so I tend to get canker sores quite frequently from a small scrape of my teeth. Something I’ve seen a lot and I will swear by too is the combination of mouthwash and Alum. The theoretical logic is sound, though in no medical expert. Mouthwash kills off most bacteria active in your mouth, and the alum dries out the cleaned sore, allowing it to heal faster. I’ll do it right before bed so I don’t fiddle around with my tongue, and use both for about 2 minutes. Just wet a q tip with some water, dab into the alum, and apply it directly on the spot. After treatment the spot becomes numb, the next day it stops growing and by the day after that the pain already starts reducing. Not completely, but it’s still way more manageable

Vitamin #B12 deficiency: vitamin B12 helps to make red blood cells and keeps your body's nervous system healthy. A lack of vitamin B12 can cause tiredness, shortness of breath and mouth ulcers.
#Iron deficiency: if your diet is lacking in iron, your red blood cells will not be able to carry as much oxygen. This can make you feel tired, lethargic (lacking energy) and dizzy. Sometimes, an iron deficiency can also cause mouth ulcers.
#Coeliac disease is caused by intolerance to a protein called gluten, which is found in wheat, rye and barley. The condition causes the small intestine to become inflamed. Mouth ulcers are also a common symptom in adults with the coeliac disease.
#Crohn's disease is a condition that causes inflammation of the gut, leading to ulcers developing in both your stomach and mouth.
Reactive arthritis is a reaction to another infection within your body. It can cause inflammation, which sometimes spreads to your mouth.
Immunodeficiency: any condition that attacks or suppresses the body's immune system (the body's natural defence against infection and illness) can cause you to develop mouth ulcers.
https://www.hse.ie/eng/health/az/m/mouth-ulcer/causes-of-mouth-ulcers.html
For example, HIV is an immunosuppressant illness.

SOLUTION - I used to get bad canker sores growing up. I’m 38 now and have successfully solved the problem. I noticed that mine were always directly related to something very acidic. Pineapple, Oranges, Lemons and some sour candy would result in a canker sore a day or two later 100% of the time. By cutting these things out completely, I just don’t get them anymore. The biggest key is, if you take a bite of something really acidic, only have a piece of it, and go brush right away immediately (1-2 min max) after eating it. If you can’t brush, you’ll need to rinse your mouth with cold water thoroughly. I’ve even went as far as to use my finger as a toothbrush with water and rubbed my inside cheeks and gums for about 60 seconds while continuing to flush my mouth with new water. I haven’t gotten a canker sore in 6+ years.

If yours is not due to acidic, it’s probably something your mouth can’t handle. Try to trace back your meals. Also, you should be able to prevent them by rinsing or brushing after every time you eat something. Don’t let food particles stay in your mouth when your done eating. I hope this helps as many people as possible because these things are the absolute worst thing to deal with.

Believe it or not, drastic/extreme changes in weather can also lead to canker sores. I live in an area where it can be cold one day and warm another before dropping again. I used to get them all the time whenever this happened - now, it can still definitely be a trigger into developing one. I don't get them as often (thank goodness, I used to get like 2-3 every month) so maybe it gets less severe as you grow older?

There are some special salves that you can rub onto the canker sore and eventually it'll numb it and help it go away faster. I forget what they are called, but they're out there - and there are special mouthwashes that help with canker sores, one made by Crest. I'd recommend going for those numbing agents when you have them...it helps a lot.

OH! And for those who get them a lot, try using organic toothpastes with soft bristled toothbrushes. I remember making a switch because I read somewhere that a certain chemical in most name brand toothpastes can trigger/worsen symptoms of a canker sore.

I figured out as a teenager why I got these so often and it turned out it was from my tooth brush and how I brushed. I started moving away from hard towards soft toothbrushes and I also changed my tooth brush more often. I found when I started noticing the bristles splaying outwards, it was time to change the tooth brush, the splayed bristles caused little punctures in the lining of my mouth, that would get infected and form an ulcer. It has worked for me, I take more care in brushing my teeth now and sometimes you can be just unlucky and bite yourself.

You can have canker sores removed by a dentist. They use a q-tip covered in Hydrochloric (edit: sulfuric and phenolsulfonic acid mixture) Acid dyed black. The dye is to make sure they can see where the acid flows, to make sure that it doesn't go anywhere it shouldn't and that they clean it all out.

Well you guys can imagine my mouth with this annoying things quite often. What I do? if they're caused for a wire of my braces or one particular brace, I try to wear the protecting wax your orthodontist give you (remember to take it off before eating, or you'll find yourself eating a lump of wax). Before going to bed, I brush my teeth and with 10vol hydrogen peroxide, I take a little in a cup, and a cotton swap and dip it into the peroxide and then place the swab for 30 seconds to 1 min only in the sore area, wait for the peroxide to drya little. Iodine also helps. Then use the wax so your cheeks can regenerate at night.

I had the worst canker sore of my life. It was bigger than the end of a q-tip. Here's how I cured it with alum powder. Don't chew your food (buy a blender) or at least chew with the other side of your mouth. You can't afford to do anything that might irritate it. Don't use toothpaste with SLS (sodium lauryl sulfate). Don't use any mouth wash except very gently swishing with the toothpaste redmond brand earth paste with activated charcoal. And it's probably a good idea not to even swish with mouthwash over the sore while it's still trying to heal. Okay so Disinfect it with hydrogen peroxide. After you disinfect it apply a small amount of alum paste that has been mixed with a drop or two of distilled water using a q-tip. This cauterizes the wound so it can seal up and finally start healing. Apply alum a maximum of 3 times a day morning afternoon and before bed. You can spit out the alum after cauterizing the wound for 60-90 seconds. Try and spit out all extra alum powder. Rinse your mouth out with water if you want to, or don't. At least always remember to spit the alum out. If you want to really dry it out faster then just spit it out and don't rinse your mouth out with water afterwards but rinsing your mouth out after applying the alum is still a viable option. Once the wound is finally sealed up after a day or 2 or 3 note that applying more alum powder does not produce the burning sensation anymore, that means the wound is sealed up completely and it should start healing on its own without needing more alum but continue doing everything else I mentioned earlier. Once the canker sore is almost gone apply manuka honey on it to complete the healing process. Also, mixing bee propolis powder with water will make a paste that helps to repair and remove dead left over cells and aslo heal potential scar tissue.

I used to get these much more often. For me, switching to a toothpaste without sodium lauryl sulfate reduced their frequency drastically.

To numb the pain, I grind up an aspirin, get some on the end of a wet Q-tip, and press it against the sore. It screams for a few seconds then slowly fades. After about 30 seconds to a minute, the drug does its job, and it takes the edge off the pain for about 4 hours.

There's also a product called Cankermelts that you stick over the canker sore, and they both cap it and release licorice extract, which has been shown to reduce the pain and duration of the sores. When they're in an inaccessible place, I stick the things on tissue that will touch the canker sore so the extract can do it's job.

Apparently a number of years ago, these nasty things were apparently linked to a surplus of Tumor Necrosis Factor Alpha in the body. Essentially, it was going into overkill on the little abrasions inside the mouth and causing huge sores.

You guys want an extremely fast way to get rid of those suckers? Well it’s simple but somewhat painful, you want to take a cotton swab or a q-tip and run one end under warm water, then you want to take some sea salt and roll the swab around the salt to collect as much as possible. After this, you want to gently and slowly roll the swab around the canker sore. This will be very painful for like 10-20 seconds but after it completely numbs it. Now I’ve been doing this for years and no sign of scaring or long term effects! Hope this helps!

Best thing for canker sores in my experience is plain old table salt. Typically a small bit swished around in your mouth will warm water after brushing will do wonders, but for the more stubborn ones, or if you have a higher pain tolerance - dampen your finger, dab it in the salt, and press that right over the canker sore. Will, like they said here, "burn like the sun" but it does the trick! After the pain numbs because your nerves are so overloaded, simply rinse with warm water. Helps canker sores heal in three days or so instead of the week or more they usually take to heal. The sooner you treat them the better!

Canker sores plagued me since I was a small child. I would sometimes have four or more at a time and some were close to dime sized. I finally talked to my doctor one time when they were so bad I couldn't even sleep.
She told me to stop using tooth paste that has sodium laurel sulfate in it(which is the ingredient used to make things lather). After a lifetime of almost constant mouth pain, within a year, I was hardly ever getting them. Now I get one a year, if that and it goes away in a few days.
Please, if you suffer from these, try this. You may have to look around or buy on line depending on where you live, but it is so worth it. Rembrandt has a paste for canker sore sufferers, and at your local Whole Foods and similar stores, you will have a choice of a few good brands. PS stay away from Tom's, all of their paste have sodium laurel sulfate.
Stay away from mouthwash for the same reason. Flossing and an electric toothbrush do a better job on bad breath anyway.
If you suffer lie I used to, you owe it to yourself to try. Won't be an overnight change, but it could be a life long one.

Mine tend to be triggered by high levels of stress, a strained immune system (like the day or two leading up to a cold), and dairy products. It took me like 28 years to realize that the more dairy products I consumed, the more canker sores I got. But since cutting back on dairy, my cankers sores have become far less frequent. I've heard other people say that milk or yogurt helps them, but for me it just prolongs them. I can't say that dairy causes canker sores in everyone, but it does seem to be something that affects me individually.

I'm shocked that he left out the only treatment that literally cures these sores instantly.  Unfortunately, I've not been able to find this remedy (at least over-the-counter in the UK) for the past few years, so they may have withdrawn it.  Basically, you dipped a cotton swab in some sort of chemical (I think I may have been Silver Nitrate) that you then dabbed onto the sore.  It chemically cauterised the sore in a matter of seconds, forming an instant scab. This scab formed a hard protective shield over the sore, which immediately blocked any further pain.  The scab then came off within the next day or two.  This was a brilliant remedy, in that unlike every other 'cure' out there....this didn't decrease the pain or speed up healing time, but instantly took care of it.  The only negative aspect of this product is that those two or three seconds after you dab the sore when the cauterisation takes place is INCREDIBLY painful...but that is totally worth it knowing that after those intense few seconds of pain....everything is done and over with!!  I wish they still sold this, as no other remedy comes remotely close to its effectiveness!!!  Anyway, if anyone knows or remembers the product I'm referring to, please let me know.  As a denture wearer, I'm unfortunatly subject to these sores on a frequent basis...and I'd sell my first-born to get my hands on some again!

I used to suffer from canker soars constantly... one would appear just as soon as the last one had healed... I tried everything... I asked doctors and dentists and no one had answers more than what this video provides.

"We really don't know what causes them." They said. I switched to SLS-free toothpastes and it seemed to help some... but not entirely.

Then, one day, it occurred to me what it was and after putting my theory to the test, I've never had one since.

You see, the one thing that every one does agree on is that canker soars are actually caused by an immune response... your body basically launches an attack on something foreign, killing the foreign entity but resulting in a very painful hole that takes about a week to heal.

My theory was that, from childhood, I had never been taught how to properly rinse after brushing. The result was that microscopic particles of toothpaste remained in my mouth as I went to bed at night just after brushing my teeth.

Ever wake up in the morning to realize that the beginning of a canker soar has developed overnight? Dentists will tell you that brushing before bedtime is critical because sugars will pool in your mouth and sit there for hours... slowly causing damage to your teeth. But what about the toothpaste that wasn't removed by rinsing?

Tiny particles of powerful cleaning agents get caught in the folds of your skin that line the insides of your lips, cheeks and under your tongue. Your body senses the threat and your immune system kicks in and sends in the troops.

If you want to test my theory, try rinsing twice every time you brush.

It's as simple as that. I can't patent the idea... I can't bottle it or sell it to you as a pill... just rinse twice. I'll check back here in a month to see if any of you have posted your results.

I found that artificial citric acid (not that from lemons or oranges) will cause canker sores for me. Many processed foods have it in them including many candy bars, microwaved meals, Doritos, ranch dressing, and even microwave popcorn. It is used as a preservative so things that sit on shelves at the stores for a long time will often have it in them.

Before buying things I always check now and it has become a buy/no buy decision maker. If there are two ranch dressings for example, I will buy the one without citric acid.

The explanation I was given for why this might be is the artificial citric acid is made using bacteria and the thought is that some people are allergic to the bacteria. I hope this helps raise awareness for other people who might have this issue. I just wish companies would stop including it in their products.

alrighty chumps. Here's some good advice from someone that gets really bad canker sores.

First, I generally get them from some kind of injury. biting my lip/cheek is the usual cause; sometimes food does it, and less frequently sometimes I'm stressed.

What you need to do when you suspect a canker sore could form, is eliminate any trigger foods in your diet, and toothpaste. For me, that's anything acidic, anything spicy, any kind of nut (including peanuts/chocolate), and bananas. If I eat any of these things, or use toothpaste, I'll get a canker sore and it will hang around for a week (often longer). If I don't do any of these things, I essentially get a baby canker sore that's generally not painful and heals in 3 days.

Honestly the most annoying part is skipping toothpaste for a few days, but I make do with baking soda. Also, I've found I can drink coffee and it doesn't make anything worse.

Finally, I have to state again that if you suspect you may have a canker sore forming, exclude all your triggers from your diet immediately. Once the pain starts, it'll stay, though you can at least keep it from growing by avoiding your triggers. Every time I bite my lip/cheek I do the above and have been basically canker free for almost 2 years. prior, I'd get them at least every month or two.

My gf gets them too and doesn't listen to my advice and it's always fun to watch her canker sores grow and grow, since the local food is spicy here. However, The few times she's done what I've done she's had the same results (essentially no canker forms). They seem to be more painful to me than to her, so she deals with it because she hates cooking and hates my cooking.

Also anything that numbs the area is essentially useless imo. Sometimes it makes things worse because you eat things that make the canker worse, it gets even more swollen, and you bite it again. And you need to use a lot of it throughout the day.

I get these ulcers a few times a year and have tried so many different remedies to speed the recovery. Then I found Kenalog. It is triamcinolone acetonide mixed with a dental paste called orabase. The paste sucks up moisture keeping the ulcer dry while the triamcinolone acetonide heals. At night dry the ulcer and apply the paste (I dab a spot of water on top of paste for comfort). The paste will feel like a tiny spot of annoying dry-mouth but this is why I use at night. If the paste has stayed on most of the night (depending where it is in your mouth) you probably won't need to use it a second time. The ulcer will be visable but almost painless, not inflamed and on it's way out. I'm from Australia so not sure if this is available in other countries but it's worth looking into if you suffer from them. Hope this helps someone.

I have Crohn's Disease and when I'm having a flare, my mouth fills up with huge canker sores the size of pennies. I use Chloraseptic and benzocaine drops to ease the pain but at that point, I'm already admitted into the hospital so the overuse of opiates by the nurses tends to make me forget about the little things in my mouth. For those of you that don't know, Crohn's disease is an illness (really basically) creates large ulcers and sores throughout the digestive tract, especially the colon. This is all inflammation, thus the Canker Sores. There's a whole bunch of stuff about it being an autoimmune disease and how it could be affected by different bacteria, but I really don't care. Are you NUTS?! Recommending use of Hydrogen peroxide(H2O2) on a canker sore will make it worse! Hydrogen peroxide should NEVER be used on wounds or sores as it destroys both bacteria AND healthy cells! Not only that but H2O2 will kill off mostly the good bacteria in your mouth and not even harm the bad bacteria that cause infection. The reason is fairly simple... those bad bacteria already produce H2O2 as a by product mainly as a weapon to kill the good bacteria in your mouth! So in lamens terms your only helping them! What you should do is Swish your mouth with alcohol based mouth wash or just plain old 100 proof or higher vodka and then eat plain unflavored yogurt, this will reestablish the good bacteria colonies while killing off most of the nasty stuff.

I've known how to get rid of canker sores since I was a kid. my dad taught me. I guess science doesn't know, but canker sores are somehow caused by some kind of infection in your mouth, similar to peptic ulcers I guess, which are also caused by a bacterium. to get rid of them, you have to soak a Q tip in hydrogen peroxide. then, holding your lip back so the sore is exposed, stab the Q tip into the sore and rip it open. this does hurt quite a bit, but it is worth it. use the Q tip to scrub out the inside of the sore. you will be amazed at how much white foam begins gushing out of the sore. you can actually hear the foam sizzling. this happens because of a reaction between the hydrogen peroxide and the bacteria. there will also be a little blood, but not much. put a little more peroxide on it and clean until it stops foaming and sizzling. all that will be left is a flat, red irritation that is mildly sore. it should stop hurting literally minutes after you do this, and by the next day there will be almost nothing there at all. I'm so happy my dad taught me this, because I used to get them almost every month or two as a kid..
